intro: Ipomoea rosea var. pluripartita, commonly known as the flame vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with intricate patterns resembling flames. The plant produces heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are typically a deep green. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil and full sunlight. Its rapid growth habit makes it an excellent choice for trellises or as a ground cover in tropical gardens.
